page.title: 04Farm Study : Part Two
page.content:
*********************
He does not have dogs or horses to help him. This year 19 lambs were born. The fleece from one sheep can weigh 3kg. This year 75 calves were born. Their two pigs had piglets this year. In Winter the animals are kept inside and have to be fed. The farmer grows Spring and Autumn corn to feed the animals in Winter. He repairs buildings and machines all through the year. In Winter it is very hard for him to feed the animals and clean the barns. In Summer he spends the day cutting grass, making hay and cutting corn. The farmer has to buy fuel, fertilizer, machinery, some feed and chickens. He sells milk, eggs, beef and corn. One cow can give 1000 litres of milk a day. The milk is sent to th dairy at Stone Bridge, Durham.
